# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is the code snippet in Julia:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump::Int=3)
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end

function timezone_bumper(d::Date)
    throw(ErrorException("Only DateTime types are accepted. Date types not allowed."))
end
```
This function `timezone_bumper` checks if the input is a `DateTime` type. If it's true, then it adds bump hours to that date-time object and returns it. On the other hand, if you pass a `Date`, the function will throw an error saying "Only DateTime types are accepted. Date types not allowed."
